intro: Acronia rhinocera, commonly known as the horned acronia, is a unique flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features prominently colored, daisy-like flowers that bloom in the spring and summer seasons. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often covered in a fine layer of white hairs. Acronia rhinocera is adapted to cold climates and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky outcrops.
